text: The women's lightweight single sculls competition at the 2019 World Rowing Championships took place at the Linz-Ottensheim regatta venue. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Sunday 25 August 2019 || 13:21 || Heats |- | Tuesday 27 August 2019 || 10:56 || Repechages |- | Thursday 29 August 2019 || 13:12 || Semifinals A/B |- | rowspan=3|Friday 30 August 2019 || 10:00 || Final C |- | 10:27 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 13:38 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Central European Summer Time (UTC+2) ==Results== ===Heats=== The two fastest boats in each heat advanced directly to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the repechages. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Nicole van Wyk | align="left"| | 8:02.14 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Emily Schmieg | align="left"| | 8:05.23 | SA/B |- | 3 | align="left"|Maia Lund | align="left"| | 8:05.39 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Emma Fredh | align="left"| | 8:10.71 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Paola Piazzolla | align="left"| | 8:12.03 | R |- | 6 | align="left"|Winne Hung Wing Yan | align="left"| | 8:19.87 | R |} ====Heat 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Marie-Louise Dräger | align="left"| | 7:57.79 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Martine Veldhuis | align="left"| | 8:01.49 | SA/B |- | 3 | align="left"|Lydia Heaphy | align="left"| | 8:01.79 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Mathilde Persson | align="left"| | 8:06.24 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Fu Xiaoyue | align="left"| | 8:26.13 | R |- | 6 | align="left"|Gabriela Mosqueira | align="left"| | 8:31.12 | R |} ====Heat 3==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Chiaki Tomita | align="left"| | 7:54.04 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Madeleine Arlett | align="left"| | 7:55.27 | SA/B |- | 3 | align="left"|Ellen Gleadow | align="left"| | 7:55.69 | R |- | 4 | align="left"|Alice Arch | align="left"| | 8:00.42 | R |- | 5 | align="left"|Alina Mochula | align="left"| | 8:34.97 | R |} ===Repechages=== The three fastest boats in each repechage advanced to the A/B semifinals. The remaining boats were sent to the C final. ====Repechage 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Ellen Gleadow | align="left"| | 7:49.77 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Mathilde Persson | align="left"| | 7:52.91 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Maia Lund | align="left"| | 7:57.20 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Winne Hung Wing Yan | align="left"| | 8:02.07 | FC |- | 5 | align="left"|Gabriela Mosqueira | align="left"| | 8:05.55 | FC |- | 6 | align="left"|Alina Mochula | align="left"| | 8:07.74 | FC |} ====Repechage 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Alice Arch | align="left"| | 7:47.82 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Paola Piazzolla | align="left"| | 7:48.13 | SA/B |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Lydia Heaphy | align="left"| | 7:48.40 | SA/B |- | 4 | align="left"|Emma Fredh | align="left"| | 7:51.59 | FC |- | 5 | align="left"|Fu Xiaoyue | align="left"| | 7:58.30 | FC |} ===Semifinals=== The three fastest boats in each semi advanced to the A final. The remaining boats were sent to the B final. ====Semifinal 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Marie-Louise Dräger | align="left"| | 7:32.77 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Madeleine Arlett | align="left"| | 7:35.20 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Nicole van Wyk | align="left"| | 7:36.36 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Alice Arch | align="left"| | 7:39.99 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Mathilde Persson | align="left"| | 7:40.11 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Lydia Heaphy | align="left"| | 7:42.23 | FB |} ====Semifinal 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Ellen Gleadow | align="left"| | 7:36.91 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Chiaki Tomita | align="left"| | 7:39.31 | FA |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 3 | align="left"|Martine Veldhuis | align="left"| | 7:41.20 | FA |- | 4 | align="left"|Maia Lund | align="left"| | 7:43.87 | FB |- | 5 | align="left"|Paola Piazzolla | align="left"| | 7:44.54 | FB |- | 6 | align="left"|Emily Schmieg | align="left"| | 7:47.94 | FB |} ===Finals=== The A final determined the rankings for places 1 to 6. Additional rankings were determined in the other finals. ====Final C==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Emma Fredh | align="left"| | 7:58.82 |- | 2 | align="left"|Fu Xiaoyue | align="left"| | 8:06.67 |- | 3 | align="left"|Gabriela Mosqueira | align="left"| | 8:09.34 |- | 4 | align="left"|Alina Mochula | align="left"| | 8:10.89 |- | 5 | align="left"|Winne Hung Wing Yan | align="left"| | 8:12.18 |} ====Final B==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time |- | 1 | align="left"|Alice Arch | align="left"| | 7:52.59 |- | 2 | align="left"|Mathilde Persson | align="left"| | 7:52.98 |- | 3 | align="left"|Emily Schmieg | align="left"| | 7:54.55 |- | 4 | align="left"|Maia Lund | align="left"| | 7:55.01 |- | 5 | align="left"|Lydia Heaphy | align="left"| | 7:55.40 |- | 6 | align="left"|Paola Piazzolla | align="left"| | 7:55.70 |} ====Final A==== {|class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" !Rank !Rower !Country !Time |- | | align="left"|Marie-Louise Dräger | align="left"| | 7:43.98 |- | | align="left"|Chiaki Tomita | align="left"| | 7:47.28 |- | | align="left"|Madeleine Arlett | align="left"| | 7:49.82 |- | 4 | align="left"|Nicole van Wyk | align="left"| | 7:53.19 |- | 5 | align="left"|Ellen Gleadow | align="left"| | 7:53.83 |- | 6 | align="left"|Martine Veldhuis | align="left"| | 7:57.74 |} ==References== Category:2019 World Rowing Championships World
title: 2019 World Rowing Championships – Women's lightweight single sculls
